trans-unit.source: Provides information about the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> elements within a <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> elements are the only allowable child elements of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument>.
The order of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> elements within the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> defines the page order.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> provides information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> elements within a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument> without the requiring the application to load individual pages.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> dependency property specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] of the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> element, see Chapter 3 of the XPS *Open XML Paper Specification* available for download at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Child%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> when:
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> has an immediate <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> child defined in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] markup.

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.System%23Windows%23Markup%23IAddChild%23AddChild%2A> has been called to set the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> as the child of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Child%2A> property returns **null** when:

The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is set by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property (when specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> is not cached).

Use <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRoot%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> to return the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> when set by the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source%2A> property.

For more information about the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> element, see Chapter 3 of the XPS *XML Paper Specification* available for download at [http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/xpsspec.mspx](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/xpsspec.mspx).
XAML Text Usage
You cannot use this property in XAML.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref>, or **null** when the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> is set by the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source"></xref> property.
Loads and returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content element.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRoot%2A> performs synchronous loading and parsing of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A>instead of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRoot%2A> to avoid thread blocking while the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> loads.

`true` to always reload the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> even if it has been previously loaded and cached; `false` to load the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> only if there is no cached version.
The root element of the visual tree for this page.
Asynchronously loads and returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content element.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> asynchronously loads and parses the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> data stream associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent>.
Other threads will continue to run while <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> completes.
The following steps illustrate how to load the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> content asynchronously:
Create a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventHandler> delegate and add it to be notified of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> events.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A>.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> event occurs and the delegate is called, the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> content has completed loading.

The loaded <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage> element is returned through the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventArgs>.<xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventArgs.Result%2A> property.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).

`true` to always reload the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> even if it has been previously loaded and cached; `false` to load the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> only if there is no cached version.
Cancels any current <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync(System.Boolean)"></xref> operation in progress.

<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsyncCancel%2A> cancels any <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync%2A> operation that has not already finished with a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> event.
Occurs when <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootAsync(System.Boolean)"></xref> has completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.GetPageRootCompleted> event is handled by methods based on the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.GetPageRootCompletedEventHandler> delegate.
Gets a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget"></xref> elements that identify the hyperlink-addressable locations on the page.
<xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.LinkTargets%2A> will never return `null`, but the collection may contain zero elements.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).

The <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTargetCollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.LinkTarget"></xref> elements that identify the hyperlink-addressable locations on the page.

Gets a value indicating whether the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Child"></xref> property should be serialized when this <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent"></xref> is serialized.
The serialization services provider.
`true` if manager is not `null` and it does not have an XmlWriter; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_uri](~/includes/tlasharptla-uri-md.md)] to the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref> content data stream.

For more information about the `<PageContent>` element and its `Source` attribute, see chapter 3 of the XPS specification which you can obtain at [XPS: Specification and License Downloads](http://www.microsoft.com/whdc/xps/downloads.mspx).
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the corresponding <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.PageContent.Source"></xref> dependency property.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddChild(System.Object)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The child <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to add.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild.AddText(System.String)"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
The text to add to the object.
For a description of this member, see <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext.BaseUri"></xref>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.PageContent> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext> interface.
The base URI of the current context.
